meanings.definition: To compress excessively or too much.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overcompress her suitcase, making it difficult to close.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overcompress the soil when planting the seeds.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to overcompress the toothpaste tube, causing it to burst.
meanings.sent4: The chef warned not to overcompress the dough, or the bread would turn out tough.
meanings.sent5: The balloon popped because she tried to overcompress it beyond its limit.

meanings.definition: To apply too much pressure or force when compressing something.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic tends to overcompress the brakes, causing them to wear out quickly.
meanings.sent2: Make sure not to overcompress the sponge or it will lose its shape.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally overcompressed the plastic bottle, causing it to deform.
meanings.sent4: The athlete knew not to overcompress his muscles during training to avoid injury.
meanings.sent5: The student had to redo the experiment because he overcompressed the sample.
